data.title: Tuscany
data.text:
The members of this family bear the titles Archduke (Archduchess) of Austria, Prince (Princess) of Hungary, and some current and recent members have claimed the right to be called Prince (Princess) of Tuscany (Imperial and Royal Highness), though the last reigning Grand Duke renounced claims to the Grand Duchy in favor of the Emperor. Descendants of morganatic marriages, except those granted specific titles such as the Princes von Altenburg, generally bear the title "Graf (Gräfin) von Habsburg-[Lothringen]", or at least the surname "Habsburg". Recently it has been reported that the House rules on equal marriages have been relaxed, and that some marriages previously deemed morganatic have been retroactively “demorganaticized”; however, it is unclear to me to which ones this applies.

Ferdinand, Archduke of Austria, was ceded the Grand Duchy of Tuscany by his father 22 Jul 1790, becoming Grand Duke FERDINANDO III. He was driven out by the French 1799 and dispossessed by the Peace of Lunéville 1801. He was cr Duke and Elector of Salzburg26 Dec 1802 and exchanged Salzburg for Würzburg 25 Dec 1805. He was Elector of Würzburg from 1805 and Grand Duke of Würzburg from 1806, until he was restored to the Grand Duchy of Tuscany30 May 1814. He was b.Florence 6 May 1769 and d.Florence 18 Jun 1824; bur S.Lorenzo, Florence. He m.1st by proxy at Naples15 Aug 1790 and in person at Vienna19 Sep 1790 Luisa Pss of Bourbon-Two Sicilies (Naples 27 Jul 1773-Vienna 19 Sep 1802; bur Kapuzinerkirche, Vienna). He m.2nd Florence 6 May 1821 Maria Pss of Saxony (Dresden 27 Apr 1796-Schloß Brandeis, Bohemia 3 Jan 1865; bur Kapuzinerkirche, Vienna)

1a) Carolina Ferdinanda Theresia (Florence 2 Aug 1793-Vienna 5 Jan 1802; bur Kapuzinerkirche, Vienna)

2a) Francesco Leopoldo (Florence 15 Dec 1794-Vienna 18 Mar 1800; bur S.Lorenzo, Florence)

3a) LEOPOLDO II Giovanni Giuseppe Francesco Ferdinando Carlo, Grand Duke of Tuscany, abdicated in favor of his son 21 Jul 1859 (Florence 3 Oct 1797-Rome 29 Jan 1870; bur Kapuzinerkirche, Vienna 1914); m.1st by proxy at Dresden 28 Oct 1817 and in person at Florence 16 Nov 1817 Maria Anna Carolina Josepha Vincentia Xaveria Nepomucena Francisca de Paula Johanna de Chantal Johanna Antonia Elisa Cunegundis Gertrudis Leopoldina Pss of Saxony (Dresden 15 Nov 1799-Pisa 24 Mar 1832; bur S.Lorenzo, Florence); m.2nd Naples 7 Jun 1833 Antonietta Pss of Bourbon-Two Sicilies (Palermo 19 Dec 1814-Orth 7 Nov 1898; bur Kapuzinerkirche, Vienna)

1b) Maria Carolina Augusta Elisabetha Vincentia Giovanna Giuseppa (Florence 19 Nov 1822-Florence 5 Oct 1841; bur S.Lorenzo, Florence)

2b) Augusta Ferdinanda Luisa Maria Giovanna Giuseppa (Florence 1 Apr 1825-Munich 26 Apr 1864; bur Munich Theatinerkirche); m.Florence 15 Apr 1844 Luitpold Pr of Bavaria (Würzburg 12 Mar 1821-Munich 12 Dec 1912)

3b) Maria Maximiliana Thekla (Florence 9 Jan 1827-Florence 18 May 1834; bur S.Lorenzo, Florence)

4b) Maria Isabella Annunziata Giovanna Giuseppa Umilta Appolonia Philomena Virginia Gabriela (Florence 21 May 1834-Bürgenstock nr Luzern 14 Jul 1901; bur Père Lachaise, Paris); m.Florence 10 Apr 1850 Francesco Pr of Bourbon-Two Sicilies, Cte di Trapani (Naples 13 Aug 1827-Paris 24 Sep 1892)

5b) FERDINANDO IV Salvatore Maria Giuseppe Giovanni Battista Francesco Lodovico Gonzaga Raffaele Ranerio Gennaro, Grand Duke of Tuscany, lost his throne 22 Mar 1860 when Tuscany was annexed to Italy (Florence 10 Jun 1835-Salzburg 17 Jan 1908; bur Kapuzinerkirche, Vienna); in 1870 he is said to have renounced all rights to the former Grand Duchy of Tuscany in favor of the Emperor, though some of his successors asserted claims to be head of the Tuscan family; he m.1st Dresden 24 Nov 1856 Anna Maria Maximiliana Stephania Carolina Johanna Louisa Xaveria Nepomucena Aloysia Benedicta Pss of Saxony (Dresden 4 Jan 1836-Naples 10 Feb 1859; bur S.Lorenzo, Florence); m.2nd Frohsdorf 11 Jan 1868 Alicia [Alix] Marie Caroline Ferdinande Rachel Jeanne Philomene Pss of Bourbon-Parma (Parma 27 Dec 1849-Schwertberg 16 Jan 1935; bur Schwertberg)

1c) Maria Antonietta Leopoldina Annunziata Anna Amalia Giuseppa Giovanna Immacolata Thekla (Florence 10 Jan 1858-Cannes 13 Apr 1883; bur Kapuzinerkirche, Vienna)

2c) Leopold Ferdinand Salvator Maria Josef Johannes Baptista Zenobius Rupprecht Ludwig Carl Jacob Bibiana, renounced his titles 29 Dec 1902 and took the name Leopold Wölfling (Salzburg 2 Dec 1868-Berlin 4 Aug 1935; bur Jerusalemer Friedhof, Berlin); m.1st Veyrier, Switzerland 25 Jul 1903 (div 1907) Wilhelmine Adamovic [Adamović, Adamowic; marriage register is not easy to read, and other spellings, such as “Abramovic”, have been inferred] (Lundenburg 1 May 1877-Geneva 17 May 1910); m.2nd Zürich 26 Oct 1907 (div) Maria Ritter (Vienna 4 Mar 1877-19__ [note: I had, from a source I cannot now find, death date of Berlin 21 Jul 1938; however, S. Lavallee points out that: "You have a precise date of death for Maria Ritter (21.07.1938). Woelfling, as we know, died in 1935. In his autobiography "From Archduke to Grocer," he actually mentions Maria Ritter's death in some type of institution during the mid-1920s. He was a bit of an eccentric, so _perhaps_ he was wrong."); m.3rd Berlin4 Dec 1933 Clara Gröger (Güldenboden [Bogaczewo] 6 Oct 1894-Berlingen, Switzerland 24 Jul 1978)

3c) Ludovica Antonia Maria Theresia Josefa Johanna Leopolda Carolina Ferdinanda Alix Erentrudis Stefania, cr Gfn von Montignoso 13 Jul 1903, and called herself Css d'Ysette from 1918 (Salzburg 2 Sep 1870-Ixelles 23 Mar 1947; bur Sigmaringen 1953); m.1st Vienna 21 Nov 1891 (div 1903) Crown Pr [later, King] Friedrich August of Saxony (Dresden 25 May 1865-Sibyllenort 18 Feb 1932); m.2nd London 25 Sep 1907 Enrico Toselli (Florence 15 Mar 1883-Florence 15 Jan 1926; bur Antella); she was called “Ludovica” in baptismal register, but usually “Louise” thereafter

4c) JOSEPH FERDINAND Salvator Franz Leopold Anton Albert Johannes Baptista Carl Ludwig Rupert Maria Auxilatrix (Salzburg 24 May 1872-Vienna 25 Aug 1942; bur Kapuzinerkirche, Vienna); m.1st (morganatically) Maria Plain 2 May 1921 (div 1928) Rosa Kaltenbrunner (Linz 27 Feb 1878-Salzburg 9 Dec 1929); m.2nd (morganatically) Vienna 27 Jan 1929 Gertrud Tomanek, Edle von Beyerfels (Brünn 13 Apr 1902-Salzburg 15 Feb 1997)

1d) Claudia Maria Theresia von Habsburg-Lothringen Pss of Florence (Vienna 6 Apr 1930-2017)

2d) Maximilian Franz Joseph Karl Otto Heinrich von Habsburg-Lothringen Pr of Florence (Vienna 17 Mar 1932-2024); m.London 3 Sep 1961 Doris Williams (b.Blundell Sands, Lancs 24 Dec 1929)

1e) Maria Camilla von Habsburg-Lothringen Pss of Florence (b.Wimbledon 29 May 1962)

5c) PETER FERDINAND Salvator Carl Ludwig Maria Josef Leopold Anton Rupert Pius Pancratius (Salzburg 12 May 1874-St.Gilgen 8 Nov 1948; bur St.Gilgen); m.Cannes 8 Nov 1900 Maria Cristina Pss of Bourbon-Two Sicilies (Cannes 10 Apr 1877-St.Gilgen 4 Oct 1947; bur St.Gilgen); his first name is given as “Petrus” in baptismal register

1d) GOTTFRIED Maria Joseph Peter Ferdinand Hubert Anton Rupert Leopold Heinrich Ignaz Alfons (Linz 14 Mar 1902-Bad Ischl 21 Jan 1984); m.Sárvár (civ) 2 Aug 1938 (rel) 3 Aug 1938 Dorothea Pss of Bavaria (Schloß Leutstetten 25 May 1920-5 Jul 2015)

1e) Elisabeth Maria Dorothea Josefa Theresia Ludmilla (b.Schloß Achberg 2 Oct 1939); m.Salzburg 28 Apr 1965 Friedrich Hubert Edler von Braun (b.Regensburg 26 Dec 1934)

2e) Alice Maria Christine Margarete Antoinetta Josefa Rosa Helene Adelgund Eleonore (b.Schloß Leutstetten 29 Apr 1941); m.Maria Plain bei Salzburg 7 May 1970 Barone Vittorio Manno (b.Cuneo, Italy 31 Jul 1938)

3e) LEOPOLD FRANZ Peter Ferdinand Maria Joseph Gottfried Georg Karl Otto Rudolf Michael (Schloß Leutstetten 25 Oct 1942-Santa Fe, New Mexico 23 Jun 2021); m.1st (civ) St.Gilgen 19 Jun 1965 (rel) Menetou-Salon 28 Jul 1965 (div 1981) Laetitia de Belzunce-d'Arenberg (b.Broumana, Lebanon 2 Sep 1941); m.2nd 18 Jun 1993 (div 1998) Marta Perez Valverde (b.San Salvador, El Salvador 13 Mar 1947); on this second marriage he renounced any rights he may have held as head of the Tuscan Habsburg branch in favor of his elder son

11c) Agnes Maria Theresia Ferdinanda Alix Antonia Josepha Ludovica Anna Amalia Germana Emanuela (Salzburg 26 Mar 1891-Schwertberg 4 Oct 1945; bur Schwertberg)

6b) Maria Theresia Annunziata Giovanna Giuseppa Luisa Virginia Appolonia Philomena (Florence 29 Jun 1836-Livorno [per Alois Jahn; not Florence] 5 Aug 1838; bur S.Lorenzo, Florence)

1c) Maria Theresia Antonia Immaculata Giuseppa Ferdinanda Leopoldina Franciska Carolina Isabella Gennara Aloisia Christina Anna (Alt-Bunzlau 18 Sep 1862-Saybusch 10 May 1933; bur Saybusch Stadtkirche); m.Vienna 28 Feb 1886 Karl Stefan, Archduke of Austria (Groß-Seelowitz 5 Sep 1860-Saybusch 7 Apr 1933)

2c) Leopold Salvator Maria Joseph Ferdinand Franz von Assisi Karl Anton von Padua Johann Baptist Januarius Aloys Gonzaga Ranier Wenzel Gallus (Alt-Bunzlau, Bohemia 15 Oct 1863-Vienna 4 Sep 1931; bur Kapuzinerkirche, Vienna); m.Frohsdorf 24 Oct 1889 Blanca Infanta of Spain (Graz 7 Sep 1868-Viareggio 25 Oct 1949; bur Viareggio); note: his names as given in baptismal register: Leopoldus Salvator Maria Josephus Ferdinandus Franciscus de Assisi Carolus Antonius de Padua Joannes Baptista Januarius Aloisius Gonzaga Reinerius Venceslaus Gallus; his names as given in marriage register: Leopold Salvator Maria Joseph Ferdinand Franz von Assisi Carl Anton von Padua Johann der Täufer Januarius Aloisius von Gonzaga Reiner Wenzel Gallus

1d) Maria de los Dolores Beatrix Carolina Blanca Leopoldina Margaretha Anna Josepha Pia Raphaela Michaela Sixta Stanislava Hieronyma Gregoria Georgia Cäcilia Carmino Barbara (Lemberg 5 May 1891-Viareggio 10 Apr 1974; bur Viareggio)
